translated: All ten of these great wrathful kings have extremely fierce appearances, wearing tiger skins as clothing and skulls as crowns, with hair buns standing upright, colored red-yellow, and each bearing Akṣobhya Buddha on their heads. Each has a sun-disk round halo and seat, with a smiling face on the front side, a slightly wrathful appearance on the right side, and a greatly fierce appearance on the left side, with sharp fangs biting the lips, furrowed brows standing like a dancing pose. In this way, the practitioner, in accordance with the Dharma, contemplates all wishes that will not be accomplished.
